title: Team
text: You can add, remove check existance User in team and etc

title: Team
text:
How to use
Examples:
Create team

from nbdev_hello.user import *

team = Team(members=[User(first_name='Jorn', last_name='Doe'), User(first_name='Yuriy', last_name='Panov')])


team

Jorn Doe, Yuriy Panov, 


Add user to team

user = User(first_name='Jonny', last_name='Gilespy')


team.add(user)

Check if user in team

user in team

True

title: user
text:
user = User('Yuriy', 'Panov')


test_eq(user, User('Yuriy', 'Panov'))


source

User

 User (first_name:str, last_name:str)

Simple user account class User




Type
Details




first_name
str
first name of user


last_name
str
last name of user




assert not test_eq(User('Yuriy', 'Panov'), User('Yuriy', 'Panov'))

title: Team
text:
source

Team

 Team (members:list[nbdev_hello.user.User]=[])

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.




Type
Default
Details




members
list
[]



Returns
None

Members




team = Team(members=[User(first_name='Jorn', last_name='Doe'), User(first_name='Yuriy', last_name='Panov')])


team

Jorn Doe, Yuriy Panov, 



User(first_name='Jorrn', last_name='Doe') in team

False



team.add(User('Semen','Polorotov'))
team.add(User('Igor','Sorokin'))


team

Jorn Doe, Yuriy Panov, Semen Polorotov, Igor Sorokin, 



sorted(team)

[Jorn Doe, Yuriy Panov, Semen Polorotov, Igor Sorokin]
